item.description: Come explore the Hop River Trail – a place where walkers, bikers, and birdwatchers can enjoy nature very close to home, along an old railroad that once went all the way to Willimantic. Wear sturdy shoes or sneakers and expect wet spots, with bumpy terrain. We will walk about 3 miles along the former railroad. The parking lot is on the east side of Colonial Road, Manchester, near its intersection with Parker Street. From Hartford, take I-84 eastbound to exit 63. Left off exit ramp onto Route 83/Route 30 toward Rockville. Go about one tenth mile, past the Big Y store and take first right onto Parker Street. Stay on Parker Street a little less than a mile, and turn left at the light onto Colonial Road. The parking lot for the Hop River Trail is on the left close to the intersection. There is a white and green sign for the Hop River state park. Extreme weather cancels. Sponsored by the CT Forest & Park Association Family Ramble Program, but all including singles are very welcome. No dogs, please. The terrain may be a bit wet, but it's fairly flat. Hike will be led by Susan Barlow of the Manchester Land Conservation Trust.

group.name: The Hartford Area Hiking™ Meetup Group

item.name: Moderate walk along Hop River trail
